reviews.sentence: Great location. The location was excellent. Enjoyed dining at the Rural Society. Staff member Innocent Concierge was extremely helpful in making suggestions for sight seeing and dining. Made a request for two beds in the room in advance but hotel was not able to acomodate. The room did not have a good view.

Very nice hotel excellent front desk service and accommodation. We put in a requested for a double bed that was not available so they gave us the roll away bed but fitted tightly in our room so switched to a corner room with lots of window loved it. I should not have complaints at all but the bathroom has very weak with running water both the sink and shower in comparison with the original room we stayed in otherwise I would give it a five star review.

Nice hotel in walking distance to the conference center and the sights. The rooms are nicely appointed and feel fresh. Although Washington traffic is noisy with honking and whistles the rooms are fairly quiet and I was right by the elevator as well. The convention center is about a 15 minute walk and about a 25 minute walk to the white house. It is an easy city to navigate and the front desk staff was helpful in providing a map and giving directionsthere is free coffee in the morning outside of the elevators and iced flavored water in the afternoons. There is a small Starbucks and a restaurant and bar. we had dinner at the restaurant one night the food was fine and moderately priced. I would recommend this hotel for both business and personal travel.

Chaos and incompetence. I have a lot of allergies and dietary restrictions. I called weeks ahead of our stay here to notify them of that. I requested a defeathered room and refrigerator. We arrived yesterday November 6th just before noon fully expecting to put our luggage in storage so that we could go shopping and have lunch. There was a good bit of confusion over a new system they were using but they went ahead and checked us into a room. I asked 3 times about the room being defeathered and the refrigerator each time I was told that it was taken care of. Upon getting to the room I found that all of the bedding had feathers. We went back to the lobby waited in line again trying to resolve this. We were told they would get everything taken care of and would move our luggage for us freeing us to leave the hotel for lunch and shopping. We returned four hours later only to find it still has not been taken care of. We waited another 30 minutes. The girl we were now working with at the front desk tried to blame it on us for trying to check in early. We were never told the checking in early was a problem and also watched many folks checking in during our long chaotic wait. After finally getting checked into our new room we once again had to request the refrigerator. This morning November 7th I stop by the desk to speak to management. She offered 2 free breakfasts which I could not take advantage of because of my dietary restrictions is anyone listening here. Finally she offered 25 off our second nights stay since that was coming out of our pocket instead of the conference sponsor. My last request before walking away from the desk was some silverware to use to eat the food I had purchased and had up in the room. She said she would have several sets sent up. Hours later I had to call and request the silverware again. we have stayed here before and enjoyed it. This time the chaos and incompetence is inexcusable and unacceptable.

Pet peeves aplenty but fine overall. My guest room had 3 features that I find particularly annoying in hotel rooms. 1. I hate showers in which the controls can not be reached except from under the water when it is turned on. This is only problematic when turning on the shower but that is kind of a major function of a shower is not it. 2. I hate trays of snacks in a room for billing on consumption that can not be put in a drawer or closet. In this case the tray was plugged in apparently to sensors. Not willing to risk getting charged for anything I put a pillow case over the whole thing. 3. If there is a fridge in a room a guest ought to be able to use it. In this case again beverages to be billed on consumption filled the fridge with sensors so it was not available for guest use. One other thing to note was that the HVAC in the room was loud enough to create troublesome background noise on a conference call I needed to take from the room. It blocked any outside noise and served as white noise otherwise but it was unusually loud. On the other hand the room had one of best hairdryers I have ever seen in a hotel bathroom and the furnishings were certainly comfortable. So overall I would stay there again but only if better choices were not available. It is comparable to other properties in the area.
Really good experience. Clean nice staff etc. Only two negatives. No refrigerator 59 a day to park.

A very nice hotel. I will return. The bed was comfortable and the hotel was quiet. I slept very well which is most important to me. The room was clean and a nice size. The staff was excellent. The room service food was not good.

Disappointed. This hotel is not family friendly. There are very noisy ice machines directly beside guest rooms and the walls are thin. Also the parking is expensive in this area. The manager indicated that she would get back to us after we shared some concerns but never did. Very disappointing experience.

Decent hotel for short trip. stayed 3 nights for city tour. Conveniently located. Lobby was beautifully decorated with modern touch. Room kept well and clean throughout our stay. Staffs were all friendly. All in all nice hotel to stay with a few notes. Elevator runs with room key so if it ’s not with you while you go 6th floor to get ice then you need to turn back and get your key card. Quite a hassle. I hurt my knees during the tour in the national mall. Went to get ice from different floor but forgot to bring my key card so had to go back to the room dragging my leg. Not fun at all. Wish they had ice machine on each floor. AC unit was bit too loud for my nighttime. Parking cost was atrocious but it ’s not the hotel ’s fault but DC ’s. 53 per night in case anyone wondering. I will consider the hotel if I ever plan to go back.

Booking with Amex Platinum. My wife and I booked the Madison pretty last minute for July the 4th weekend as the prices here were inexplicably low compared to everywhere else that was comparable. She is an Amex Platinum cardholder so we booked with that through Amex Travel which meant we received a 100 Hotel Credit and free upgrade if available. My wife also used the Amex Platinum to get Hilton Gold status which may have factored in. Anyway sure enough we got an upgrade to the Executive level or whatever they call it. In reality the room itself was exactly the same as a normal room as far as I could tell except that it was on one of the highest floors but across from another tall building so not a great view. The real advantage of getting upgraded however is that everyone on that level gets complimentary lounge access which for us meant free breakfast every morning which was excellent and snacks in the evening. However apparently DC regulations do not allow them to offer free alcoholic drinks in the lounges. For the 100 Hotel Credit we were disappointed it was not as useful as we had hoped. It was valid for pretty much everything except the restaurant and bar. If we had not had breakfast included I think we could have spent it on the fancy lounge breakfast but we ended up just spending it on 9 canned beers from the little coffee shop marketplace which was not great value. It was also valid on the self serve wine machine kinda cool in the lounge but we found this to be way over priced at 14 for a glass of wine. The location was great within a third of a mile of a station for any of the metro lines and walking distance or certainly a quick Lyft or scooter ride to most of DCAl in all we had a great stay the hotel felt luxurious and new the staff was helpful and it felt like a steal considering it was well cheaper than even any of the nearby Hampton Inns or Hilton Garden Inns.

Family vacation. First time in Washington DC We enjoyed the Madison Hilton dc everyone was nice Breakfast was very good room are clean The concierge Kaouthar was great. She provide us with a tour and restaurant recommendations. Location is fabulous and the hotel hotel decor is so good.

great hotel. We just returned from a 5 day stay at this hotel. We loved the location centrally located and a short 10 15 min. walk to the White House. The hotel has a mini Starbucks inside with lots of choices for breakfast snacks and lite lunch items. The bar does not open until 4 which is a little weird and is a little pricey but has daily specials. Our room faced 15th st and was surprisingly quiet. The staff is friendly helpful and attentive. We would definitely stay here again.

Great hotel and fantastic servicd. We stayed at the Madison as part of our honeymoon. We thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of our stay including the rooms which were spacious clean and nice. The restaurant had excellent food we were served by Abdul who took care of everything and made sure we had a great dining experience. The included breakfast buffet was also great we were hosted each morning for breakfast by Boris who was always happy for a chat to ask what we were doing that day and give us tips on the DC area. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in DC it ’s also close to most of the places we visited during our stay.

Beautiful Hotel. Excellent customer service. Everyone was so nice And friendly. The hotel is centrally location Near the White House and the national mall The good is so good The room. is very clean and nicely decorated Kaouthar was overly helpful. She suggested a wonderful eatery and tours Amber and Stephanie are so nice and helpful I recommend this hotel to anybody ’s.

Pleasant stay at Madison. I arrived at Madison Hilton in Washington DC hours before the checkin time. As I just arrived on an early morning flight I was exhausted and needed to rest before heading to my meetings. Fortunately I met Ms Kawouthar who was exceptionally pleasan and helpful. She quickly found me a room that was ready. This is a pleasant experience that I would wish for all travelers. ESHETE.

Mrs Cynthia Johnson. I loved our room it was beautiful. The staff at the front desk was very helpful a d knowledgeable about the questions we asked. They did nt try to rush us away the door men were nice and very pleasant also.

Business stay. Stayed here for a week last month for business. Front desk staff was very nice and amazingly had a room ready for me when I got in at 10 am despite being told there would not be one available when I called before my flight that morning. Breakfast was good but expensive. There are other options around for breakfast. Room was clean quiet and had good hvac. The little things were also nice there was always someone there to open the door for me before I got to it cleaning staff always greeted me warmly in the hallway and asked if I needed anything etc.

Great location and rooms. Rooms super clean quiet and hotel was close to everything. it is odd to say but elevators were super fast which was very nice. staff great and helpful and positive demeanors it is a place to go back to.
Excellent hotel. Stayed in suite with balcony.

Great staff and location in center of Wasington DC. HotelWe stayed for 7 nights on the 12th floor very quiet since our room was at the end of the halReception area is very warm and friendly. You can always find people chatting and enjoying themselves in the lobby bar and restaurant areaDecor in the lobby is beautiful and inviting a nice area to be in when waitingExecutive lounge is a great area to watch TV and relax if you are a Hilton Honors member with Gold or higher. it is also a place to get work done on a laptopRom and bathroom are clean and as expected. Hot water in the bathroom is acceptable in temperature and heater works perfectly at the desired warmthI like that the cleaning staff is very quiet and you will never feel bothered you will be given full privacy using the door tag if you do not need much housekepingThe 3 elevators are fast and perfect I never had to wait and they open and close quicklyConcierge service was great. You will get text messages asking if you need anything from the hotel and make requests by texting back. LocationLocation on a main road is great for Uber pickup. There are always taxis outside the hotel or a quick walk to the Metro if you prefer. There are multiple e bikes scooters around outside available to useAround the corner is a 7Eleven and a CVS convenience store both are open 24 hours a dayShort 10 minute walk to the White House. For a longer 30 minute walk you can go to the World War II memorial and Lincoln Memorial. Also there at the National Mall is the Washington Monument. TipsThe minifridge is stocked with snacks which can be good if you want to eat them but there will not be space to store your items. You can request and extra fridge for a feNo robes are in the room but they can be requested for freParking can be expensive since this hotel is in a prime location next to a main road so contact hotel for options if you need parking. I always use Uber or walk. The Metro is also nearbyAsk ahead for a room with a view if you want a better city or street view.
